visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts bar chart with the title 'Most popular ideas by April 2016'. The chart should have a bar type, with a scrollable plot area and a margin on the right. The x-axis should be of category type with no title, and the y-axis should have a title 'Votes' aligned to the high position. The chart should display data labels on the bars and should not show the legend or credits. The data series should include the names of the ideas and their corresponding votes.

series.name: Votes
data: Autocalculation and plotting of trend lines
Allow navigator to have multiple data series
Stacked area (spline etc) in irregular datetime series
Adapt chart height to legend height
Add ability to change Rangeselector position
Add Navigation bar for Y-Axis in Highcharts Stock
Draw lines over a stock chart, for analysis purpose

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a bar chart with specific settings. The chart type is set to 'bar', allowing for a vertical bar representation of the data. The title of the chart is 'Most popular ideas by April 2016', and a subtitle provides a source link to UserVoice. The x-axis is configured as a category axis, suitable for displaying the names of the ideas, while the y-axis is titled 'Votes' and aligned to the high position. Data labels are enabled on the bars to show the vote counts directly on the chart. The legend and credits are disabled to keep the chart clean and focused on the data. The series data includes the names of the ideas and their corresponding vote counts, formatted as an array of arrays.
